headline: Penne with Shrimp
description: Tomatoes and onions are sauteed with garlic and wine, tossed with shrimp, and served with pasta in this quick and easy entree.
name: Penne with Shrimp

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.
Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat. Stir in onion and garlic, and cook until onion is tender. Mix in wine and tomatoes, and continue cooking 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Mix shrimp into the skillet, and cook 5 minutes, or until opaque. Toss with pasta and top with Parmesan cheese to serve.

review.reviewBody: Excellent recipe. Added red pepper and basil. Only changed pasta to what I had on hand. Love it!

This was DELICIOUS and easy to make. The only change I made was, starting off with pancetta and then adding the onion and garlic, etc. My family and I loved it, definitely adding it to the repertoire.

This is so quick & delicious! I made it pretty much the same with just a few substitutions & additions. I used Vidalia onion because it’s what I had, & I used 2 cans of petite diced tomatoes with green chilies for a touch of heat. I added sliced zucchini, baby spinach, & 1/4 cup of balsamic vinegar, then I drizzled balsamic reduction over the dish after I plated it.

Good, but I agree with other reviewers that it needs more seasoning. I added red pepper flakes, salt, Italian seasoning, as well as extra garlic and wine. It still seemed a little bland. Next time I will use less penne, keeping the same amount of shrimp and sauce.
just as advertised, very quick and easy. I made no changes to the recipe and it turned out great.
just as advertised, very quick and easy. I made no changes to the recipe and it turned out great.
Made this last week and it was very good. Only change was for the number of servings.
Very tasty and quick to make
Made it for my wife. Quick easy and awesome. Try it.

Some of my favourite ingredients were listed in this recipe...all of which I had on hand...so I was really excited to try it for supper tonight! It turned out to be very bland and disappointing. Not sure if I will make it again but if I do, I would have to zip it up with some herbs and spices. I’m not so good without suggestions and measurements so I think that truthfully I will look for a similar recipe with extra flavour enhancers listed.
instead of wine i used rice vinegar . my daughter loved it

This recipe needs a few more ingredients. It's a little bland. The basic recipe is fine but it needs some thing like some green onions, parsley, other herbs. I would certainly make it again but add something to it.

Really a good recipe. Perfect for summer as it isnt a heavy meal. I took a few suggestions from the reviews and added crushed red pepper , basil, and oregano to the garlic and onions and that really set it off. I also added fresh diced tomatoes , simply because I had them cut up and needed to use them , and that gave it an even fresher summer taste. Delicious. Good with chicken pieces as well. Just cook them in the oven with olive oil, salt and pepper, dice the chicken pieces and add. Thanks so much! I've used this recipe several times.

This recipe is quick and delicious! It will be an easy goto for busy nights. The shrimp can easily be substituted with chicken or pork. This is going to become a family favorite. Since there are only two of us these days, I cut it in half. Another time, I will probably make the 4 serving version and freeze half.
It needed more shrimp so the next time I doubled them.
Easy and tasty. I did add some hot pepper flakes based on other peoples recommendations.

I always switch things up in recipes so I only added one can of tomatoes, more garlic, a little Parmesan and some fresh basil.
Thanks for the recipe. We really enjoyed it! And I got to drink the remainder of the wine for dinner!
Good base, but I agree with those who added more garlic and wine, and fewer tomatoes. Some black pepper helped, too.

I used only one can of diced tomatoes (Italian style), added more garlic and some red pepper flakes. Also used thawed cooked shrimp. It was very good, thumbs up from the family. I’ll make it again. Thanks!
Substituted ravioli (cheese, spinach etc.) for penne pasta. Otherwise followed recipe. New family favorite!

I used whole grain pasta and fresh, greated parmesan cheese and fresh ground pepper. I added the aldente pasta to the finished sauce and allowed it to soak up the extra liquid. It was perfecto! I will make this again and again....
Great easy and quick recipe . I just added fresh basil and Italian seasoning .
Tastes like you worked all day on it. We loved it.
This was actually a really good dish. I was concerned when I saw a few reviews calling it "bland". So I used extra garlic / onions and I also used fire roasted tomatoes. Lots of flavor!

Excellent especially with a few variations for our particular taste. After reading the comments I decided to use just one can of chopped tomatoes, 1/4 cup tomato sauce and 1/4 cup of wine. I like the Italian taste so I increased the minced garlic to three heaping tablespoons and added basil to onion and garlic mixture as it was cooking and Italian seasoning in the tomato mixture as it was cooking in a small pot.. Before serving I added a small amount of butter and garlic salt to the penne so it wouldn't stick together and negated the need to have sauce on every noodle. I thought about adding the crushed red pepper but my husband like simple and not spicy. He loved this dish and told me would definitely eat it again.
I added more shrimp and onions. To reheat for leftovers I removed the shrimp and added another can of tomatoes. Then added the shrimp back for about a minute. Perfect!
Yummy!!

Surprised at this recipe, it looks very simple the ingredients but turned out quite well.. looked at the comments online and found out that it is a good idea to add butter and the garlic to the shrimp in a separate pan and then add it to the tomato sauce fantastic recipe was looking for second helpings.
cooked shrimp in garlic/oil, removed, cooked rest with fresh basil, added shrimp at end. more wine

I made it and it turned out great. Like others, I modified it. I used fire roasted diced tomatoes, added a small can of tomato sauce and a little more wine. I added mushrooms, crushed red pepper and some italian seasoning! Everyone loved it!
Great and easy. I did however adhere to the other reviews and added some additional spices. You have to make that sauce hurt in order to make it less blend.

As someone recommended, I cooked the shrimp separate with sea salt, pepper, and butter. Also added more garlic to the sauce. Thanks for sharing this recipe. I love recipes that are tasty and easy to make.
Added a little oregano and sweet basil. Followed the directions otherwise. It was delicious
Good starting point but as others have said more wine, crushed red and black pepper, fresh basil and ripe vine tomatoes instead of tasteless canned ones really boosts the flavour.
Quick, easy and delicious! A real keeper.
too mant tomatoes
The only change I’d make is to add a fresh herb as a topping.
used crushed tomatoes and added basil, it was a good quick dish

I will make this again! I was out of canned tomato, I used a fresh one, it was good, next time I will get the canned tomatoe. Also I used organic vegetable broth for the white wine. I really like red onion with pasta , it has great flavor! Shrimp is so cute and fluffy I plan on making it more often and trying the other Penne pasta recipes.

Absolutely delicious...Just made a few changes. Left the wine out, added 1/4 tsp of crushed red pepper flakes, 1/4 cup of chopped fresh basil and precooked shrimp. More like a Fra Diavolo. This basic sauce, however is easy and quick! Will make again.
This was awesome and easy! I did add portabella mushrooms and black olives....... Both sliced!!
I read reviews and added spices, crush pepper. It was yummy. I needed more shrimp but very tasty.
I used two pds 51/60 shrimp, and added a red bell pepper

I made it as the recipe called for but when I make it again, I will use the diced tomatoes that have the garlic already in them (very time saving) and will use more of it. I didn't think there was enough sauce or shrimp for the amount of pasta. Really like the flavor combination though. Maybe fresh parmesan would be nice ,too.
Great sauce for the shrimp. Flavorful yet not spicy. This is a keeper!
the family loved it!
I opted to use Fiery Roasted diced tomatoes and added extra garlic. to kick up the flavor. Very yummy. Thanks for sharing your recipe.

This was a very easy, quick and healthy recipe. I made it as is and liked it. After tasting it, I shook a bit of seafood seasoning on it and, because I'm lactose intolerant, I added a very small amount of lactose free sour cream which I think made it a bit creamy and I liked that change.

This is a great base for a start. I dbld the garlic, added chopped baby bell peppers, a bag of baby spinach and added 1 cup of white wine. I seasoned it with Italian seasoning, basil and crushed red pepper flakes, salt and pepper to taste, and let this simmer while I cooked the pasta and shrimp. I tossed the shrimp with olive oil, salt and pepper, Italian seasoning and 1 clove minced garlic and sauted before adding to the pasta and sauce. I tossed 1 cup of parmesan cheese in the dish and served some on the side. Hubby loved this. I will definitely be making this again.

Made significant changes based on reviews by others. Reduced the pasta to 8 oz. to serve just the two of us. Used only one can of diced tomatoes and doubled the garlic, wine and red onion. Also added chopped fresh parsley when tossing the pasta in the sauce. This is destined to become one of those non-recipe recipes that will evolve over time. 

Thanks so much for the inspiration!
Not bad, not bad..
Yes, I used linguine instead of penne. I added a sauce to it and it came out so good .

The wine made the sauce a bit tart but I think it was the wine I used, LOL! ;) Very easy and good recipe- my son and husband really enjoyed this. I also added a dash of sugar (Sorry- had to) and oregano and simmered for a while before serving to calm the tartness. I topped with fresh Italian Parsley, fresh grated Parmesan Cheese and served with nice garlic bread and a fresh salad. YUM! Great weeknight meal.

I use a better grade of grated cheese by Locetelli , which is found in the child section of the deli department. This way I can get a blend of both pecorino and parmesan.
Also added more garlic as it is needed for a better flavor. Light does not have to mean no flavor.
Love it will make no changes
Looks Very Delicious
Extremely boring!!!
This lacked flavor as others have said. Should you want it more robust, add some red pepper and a lot more garlic.

Made this tonight for dinner for me and my husband. It was really good and I made it pretty much by the recipe as written. I just splashed the wine...didn't measure...used a little less shrimp and only one can of petite diced tomatoes. Chopped a little fresh parsley and added it. I thought it was pretty excellent but it did need a little more of something.....a little bland. Will make again...quick and easy and would be restaurant quality with a little more salt, pepper and maybe a tich of cayenne. Will do it again soon
I added zuchini, oregano, italian seasoning, and red pepper mill for a slightly spicy kick ??

This recipe is OK. I agree with man who say this is a good starter. Also, like others suggest, the recipe needs some herbs. I added a tiny bit of tomato paste as I noticed that it was too watery. Maybe try Italian style diced tomatoes for added flavor and more garlic. The recipe is not WOW! but is not bad either.

This would have been boring if I just followed the recipe here, but it was a good base. I added more garlic, a lot of Italian seasoning, some basil, and a lot of Parmesan cheese ?? I think it would have been really good with some Cajun seasoning too!
I added a little more wine and garlic salt and pepper.

I changed the recipe up by first sautéing the red onion, garlic in butter instead of olive oil (didn't have any on hand) with a teaspoon on red pepper flakes. Then added 1 cup of wine into a wine reduction, then added diced tomatoes with oregano. The meal turned out to be delicious!

Followed some of the suggestions of other reviewers- added basil and increased the garlic. Had only pre-cooked shrimp on hand but will follow the suggestion to get uncooked and saute in garlic butter. Very mild flavor but I really liked it. I used a Chardonnay that I had which worked well
Excellent, quick & easy. Used precooked, frozen shrimp and added Italian seasoning to taste and tomato paste to thicken the sauce a little.
was so good!

I accidentally put in diced tomatoes with chili's and garlic. It came out nice and spicy. The directions didn't say to drain the tomatoes but with that and the wine , I reduced it longer. Plenty of shrimp. Will make again.

Pretty darn good. I added a squirt of tomato paste and more garlic but changed little else. We added fresh whilted spinach for extra color and a bit of sugar to reduce the acidity of the tomatoes. Easy, adaptable and flavor easily improved using fresh herbs/spices and good quality ingredients overall.

This is a simple, quick and delicious meal, a great weeknight dinner. I made 1/2 recipe, albeit with the full amounts of onion and garlic (since I love both), and added Italian herbs, as other reviewers suggested. As the sauce was cooking it looked somewhat dry, so I added a bit of pasta water & another splash of wine. The result was much tastier than I had expected--nice tomato flavor with plump, juicy shrimp. Yum!
Added spinach for extra touch.
We loved it. I did modify it some by using grape tomatoes instead of canned and I added Italian seasoning for more favor.. It is a definite keeper. So easy to make.
simple, looks great, tastes great too

This was very tasty, with only a couple of modifications. I used a quart of roma tomatoes canned from the garden. The onion and garlic were sauteed in herbed olive oil to add more flavor. A little salt and pepper and the rest is history. My husband loved it and looks forward to me making it again. .
Been making over and over. Love it

This recipe was very good as a start---but I thought that it was too bland for our tastes. Add some extra garlic, a pepper blend of spices and some crushed red pepper flakes. Served with a bit of extra parmesan on top, it was delicious.
It was so basic that the one redeeming factor made me remember how basic is sometimes good.
Didn't make any changes and will be making this again. Very tasty and quick to make.
Family loved it. Bowers did add salt, pepper, and a pinch of oregano. Next time will try fresh basil.
I found it to be 2 dry, I added a can of cream of mushroom soup, but it was still pretty bland, and I think a 1/2pound of penne would probably be somewhat better, it was too much pasta.

I made it, it was very good. I might add a little fresh basil next time but it was very good, and even better the next day. I liked it very much. Thx for the recipe & your website. I learn a lot from it!.
Made it as the recipe directed. It was good, however I and my wife agree it could use more garlic and some additional spices like crushed red pepper, basil, oregano , etc to kick it up to 5 stars.

Like many other reviewers this was pretty bland. My typical procedure with a new recipe is follow directions the first time ; however, after tasting, I knew it needed more flavor. I added a lot of garlic, basil, Italian seasoning and even after all of that, I am on the fence about making it again. The upside is that the recipe is simple and fast and sauted chicken could replace shrimp.
I will be making this again! My husband raved about it for two days!!!
A wonderfullly flavorful dish. Gourmet quality that can be served at a dinner party. This recipe was three full meals for two Senior citizens!
We loved it. I did add Some pepper flakes and some Parmesan
I drained the tomatoes so it wasn't too watery. My husband and I both enjoyed this and will make it again.
I added a few more cloves of garlic, and more Italian seasoning, but it was still OK. I like cream sauces, so I guess I should have known. Too bland.
excellent light tasting dinner!! fast and easy wonderful for a weeknight meal in a hurry or for a large dinner party!!
Very good! Served over penne pasta. 1/2 box of pasta is too much for 2 people.
Great easy recipe !

The recipe was great! I didn't change anything. The only change I wish I knew how to make would be to make the tomatoes a little less "biting." Somewhere, I've read that a teaspoon of sugar might counter the acidity of the tomatoes--maybe that's the solution.
was good
Extremely tasty and easy to make.
Will definitely make again!
I think the next time I make, I will add some heavy cream to it and more seasoning. Other than that, my family enjoyed it.

I made it exactly according to the recipe. I loved the simplicity and all ingredients, but found it somewhat bland. I'm not the kind of cook who knows intuitively how to improve recipes, so I appreciate the other reviews that provided suggestions. I will make it again incorporating some of the suggestions I read.
Wasn't what I expected. Couldn't taste garlic and onion. Would be much better with fresh tomatoes.
It was light, simple, and boring. There is a bit of the garlic flavor that comes through, but the sauce is thin and watery.
